episode_name: Parshas Devarim - Honoring Others, Elevating Ourselves
episode_description: Parshas Devarim Honoring Others, Elevating Ourselves  Why did Moshe Rabbeinu rebuke Klal Yisrael through hints instead of directly? What is the true power of embarrassment, and how did it lead to the Churban Beis Hamikdash? Join Reb Asaf Aharon Prisman as he delves into the vital importance of giving Kavod and avoiding embarrassing others at all costs. Discover the deeper meaning behind valuing every Yid as a reflection of the Ribbono Shel Olam. Learn how even the slightest rebuke can shake a person to the core and the responsibility we have when giving Tochachah. Hear an amazing vort about the danger of crushing someone's spirit and how it can make or break their teshuvah. You won't want to miss these essential and timely insights - tune in now to uncover the full depth and transform your interactions!  Always on www.prismoftorah.org

episode_name: Parshas Vaeschanan - Self Worth
episode_description: Uncover the hidden connection between honoring parents and overcoming envy in this week's parsha. How do the Ten Commandments reveal the secret to genuine self-worth? Join us as we explore the profound link between the fifth and tenth commandments, and discover how understanding your true value can transform your relationship with others and yourself. Dive into Va'etchanan's timeless wisdom and learn how to break free from the chains of comparison in our modern world. Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

episode_description: Discover the transformative power of gratitude in Parshat Eikev. What's the significance of reciting 100 blessings daily, and how can this practice revolutionize your relationship with Hashem? Join us as we unpack the deeper meaning behind this ancient custom and explore its connection to developing a profound fear of Heaven. Learn how acknowledging the mundane can lead to extraordinary spiritual growth and a heightened awareness of Hashem's constant presence in our lives.www.prismoftorah.org Hosted on Acast. episode_name: Parshas Eikev - Perception Is Reality
episode_description: In this thought-provoking episode, join us as we explore the profound concepts behind accepting the yoke of mitzvos and the true burden of fulfilling Hashem‚Äôs commandments. Delving into seforim and teachings, we unravel the mysteries of why certain mitzvos, seemingly trivial, hold immense significance in our spiritual journey. Discover how the perception of obligation shapes our rewards, and why daily reaffirmation of our commitment is crucial. Why does the famed translator Unkelus emphasize acceptance over performance? What secrets lie within Rashi's interpretation of "ekev"? Journey with us to uncover the essence a Yids true devotion and prepare to embark on a transformative path leading up to the yomim noraim.

episode_name: Parshas Eikev- Short-Term Thirst, Long-Term Growth
episode_description: Why did Hashem allow enemies in Eretz Yisrael to be stronger than Klal Yisrael? What deeper meaning lies behind drinking water? How can challenges bring us closer to Hashem? In this episode of Prism of Torah, Reb Asaf Aharon Prisman explores Parshas Eikev, revealing hidden blessings within our struggles. Discover how basic needs contain the key to unlocking a deeper Divine connection. Explore the wisdom behind Hashem's tests and how they help us grow in emunah. Whether facing personal trials or seeking meaning in the mundane, this episode will open your eyes to the beauty of Hashem's plan. Tune in for an inspiring experience!

episode_name: 16: Parshas Re'eh- Seeing the reality
episode_description: Parshas Re'eh: Seeing the reality Download link: https://bit.ly/3pEpu8f Website: www.prismoftorah.com This week we take a deep dive to understand the order of the blessings and the curses. Is the emphasis on the blessings or the curses? Is the emphasis on the seeing or the listening? Including a truly miraculous story from the bus crash last week!

episode_name: Parshas Reeh - Home Court Advantage in The Game of Life
episode_description: Have you ever wondered how the seemingly innocent environments we inhabit can profoundly shape our spiritual journey? What if the very act of witnessing others' behaviors could influence your own neshamah, even without your conscious awareness? In this eye-opening episode of "Prism of Torah," we delve into Parshas Re'eh's hidden wisdom, uncovering the startling power of our surroundings. Prepare to be challenged as we explore a perplexing pasuk that, at first glance, defies logic ‚Äì yet holds the key to safeguarding your spiritual growth. Through the illuminating lens of the Michtav Me'Eliyahu, we'll unravel this mystery, revealing practical strategies to fortify your connection with Hashem in today's complex world. Discover the surprising link between judging others favorably and protecting your own neshamah. Don't miss this transformative journey ‚Äì tune in now and elevate your Avodas Hashem!  Always on www.prismoftorah.org

episode_name: Parshas Re'eh - Living the Present
episode_description: Unlock the secret to a more fulfilling life with Parshas Re'eh's timeless wisdom. Why does the Torah emphasize "today" when discussing blessings and curses? Dive into Rabbeinu Bechaye's enlightening interpretation and discover how focusing on the present moment can transform your spiritual journey. Learn to navigate life's ups and downs with equanimity, and uncover the power of trusting in Hashem's plan, even when circumstances seem dire. Hosted on Acast. episode_name: 17: Parshas Shoftim- Who are you?
episode_description: 17: Parshas Shoftim- Who are you? With Reb Asaf Aharon Prisman, The prism of Torah. Available to download: https://bit.ly/3cxFXZ2 Discover the message of Elul and Parshas Shoftim. As we look at why there is an individual commandment to create judges, how? Where? What is the deeper meaning of the Passsuk? We take the time to explore the different acronyms for the word Elul, why this has to do with unintentional killing. Our Father in heaven is our third partner in bearing children. What does he provide? How does this affect us? All and much more on this weeks Parsha! episode_name: Parshas Shoftim- When Right Feels Wrong
episode_description: Parshas Shoftim- When Right Feels Wrong What profound wisdom lies hidden in the Torah's instruction to follow our sages, even when their guidance seems to contradict our own intuition? How can the unique perspective of our rabbis help us navigate life's complexities and stay true to Hashem's will? Join us as we delve into the deeper implications of the phrase "lo sasur yamin u'smol" in Parshas Shoftim. Discover the transformative power of humility and trust in our sacred tradition as timeless stories and eye-opening insights illuminate the path to spiritual growth. With Chodesh Elul upon us, explore how aligning our souls with the wisdom of our leaders can elevate our teshuvah and connection with the Divine. Unlock the secret to making decisions that resonate with your highest purpose - listen now and embark on a journey of profound self-discovery!   Always on www.prismoftorah.org

episode_name: Parshas Ki Seitzei: When Opposites Attract Blessings
episode_description: Have you ever wondered why the mitzvos of kibud av v'eim and shiluach haken, despite their stark differences, share the same reward of arichas yamim? The Vilna Gaon reveals a profound insight that connects these mitzvos to our spiritual growth, demonstrating how even the most challenging tests can bring us closer to Hashem. Discover the key to achieving true shleimus and how to unlock it during the crucial days of Elul. Learn from a true, exciting story that also acts as a perfect Elul parable. Join us on this transformative journey as we explore these eye-opening ideas and embark on a path of self-discovery that will make this Elul a truly elevating experience.

episode_name: 18: Parshas Ki Seitzei - How is your hearing?
episode_description: Reb Asaf Aharon Prisman on the Parsha, the prism of torah! Download: https://bit.ly/3exWLjq A rebellious child, eating meat, drinking wine, he is put to death; we are told as his end will be so bad. Yishmoel was kicked out of his house and survived. Why was he saved and the rebellious child killed? Do we not give this child a chance? What drastic thing did he do to cause death? When we think about the most important body part, we think of the eye, heart, or brain. What does Judaism have to say on the matter‚Ä¶ all this and more this week. episode_name: Parsha Ki Seitzei‚Äì Mitzvos are not in the way, they are the way
episode_description: Uncover the hidden wisdom within Parsha Ki Setzi in our latest podcast episode! üéß This week, we delve into the intriguing concept of the rebellious child, Ben Soyer Umorer. Question 1: Why does someone indulging in simple pleasures seemingly deserve the death penalty? üîç Why is a child punished for mere indulgence in wine and meat? Isn't it too severe a punishment? üîç Question 2: How does the story of Yishmoel, who was saved by a well in the desert, relate to Ben Sorer Umorer? üîç Question 3: Why does Rosh Hashanah precede Yom Kippur? Shouldn't forgiveness come before judgment? What does this have to do with the Ben Sorer Umorer? Tune in as we share a thought-provoking perspective on this order and how it ties into recalibrating our mindset. Join us for this thought-provoking podcast episode, where we explore these questions and much more! Gain fresh insights into how our choices shape our lives, as we prepare for the Yomim Noraim and reflect on our personal paths.

episode_name: Parshas Ki Savo: Unlocking Your Spiritual ATM
episode_description: In Parshas Ki Savo, we encounter a puzzling question: why would we receive such severe curses simply for doing mitzvos without Simcha? We will also tackle the question of what is the repetitiveness in the Tehillim we say twice a day in Elul, "L'Dovid Ori," as Dovid HaMelech says, "One I ask (Sheilah)... this is what I am requesting (Bakasha)"? Uncover the key to ensuring our commitment to Hashem's mitzvos lasts a lifetime and gain a fresh perspective on the true nature of our Bakashos, especially as we approach Rosh Hashanah, which holds in it the DNA for the upcoming year. We will discover how to tap into the transformative power of these special days and make the most of this opportune time. Listen now to elevate your Elul experience, strengthen your connection with Hashem, and unlock the secret to enduring inspiration in your Avodas Hashem.   Always on www.prismoftorah.org

episode_name: Parshas Netzavim - Teshuvah - Hard or Easy?
episode_description: Is teshuvah truly as easy as the Torah suggests, or do we make it harder than it needs to be? Explore this paradox and learn why the biggest obstacle to teshuvah might be our own habits. This timely episode offers encouragement and practical advice for making the most of the Days of Awe. episode_name: Parshas Netzavim Unveiling the Heart of Rosh Hashanah
episode_description: Have you ever pondered the profound connection between the Shofar and personal transformation? What distinguishes the various calls of the shofar, and why do they seem contradictory? Do they evoke feelings of joy or fear? Are you curious about how the Shofar can recalibrate your life and ignite self-reflection? Is it beneficial to approach Rosh Hashanah with a hint of trepidation?  Embark on a journey of self-discovery and spiritual awakening. Don't miss out‚Äîtune in now to uncover profound answers that will enrich your comprehension of Rosh Hashanah and the remarkable significance of the Shofar!

episode_name: Parshas Netzavim/Vayeilech - Minimal Effort, Maximum Elevation
episode_description: Whose responsibility is it to remove the barriers separating us from Hashem - ours or His? There appears to be a head-on contradiction between Parshas Ekev and Parshas Nitzavim. Discover the profound insights hidden within the words "HaNistaros" and "HaNiglos," and explore the deeper meaning behind the heavenly voice that calls out to us during Elul. How can we tap into our spiritual potential and make the most of this auspicious time? How can we get a spiritual upgrade? Rabbi Prisman shares a concept on the power of human effort and the boundless love of Hashem, illustrating these concepts with a fascinating mashal about eagles and their young. As we approach the Days of Awe, this episode will inspire you to embark on a transformative journey of personal growth and connection with the Divine. www.prismoftorah.org
